page.title: 11Farms and farming.
page.content: There are a lot of farms in our Domesday block .They are mostly of about 200 acres. Some of the farms have sheep and cattle but mostly they are arable farms.The crops which are grown are wheat, barley, oilseed rape and peas.The peas are grown for Birds Eye to be frozen.Most of the oilseed rape goes to Cranswick Mill for processing, about four miles east of the block.The barley is used mainly for cattle feed and wheat is sent away to be stored.Some farmers gave a tonne of wheat for Ethiopia.When the sheep are sheared the wool is set to the woollen mills.ome farmers grow kale,swedes and sugar beet.There is a huge sugar mill in York where the beet is taken.
